task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 238°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the top of the building to estimate its height, so I will tilt my view upwards.
I have been incorrectly turned to face North; I need to rotate back to the South-West (approx. 238°) to see the target building again.
I have reoriented myself towards the target building and now need to look up to see its full height for estimation.
The system has incorrectly reset my heading to North again; I must rotate back to the target building at 238° South-West and then look up.

I can now see the top of the building; by counting the approximate number of floors (around 12) and assuming a standard height of 3.5 meters per floor, I estimate the total height to be about 42 meters.
